result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paxton Joseph Soik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:38 p.m. Defendant Paxton Joseph Soik in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CT348, 16CM102, 16CM158, 15TR3239, and 15TR3240.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM102 No Contest
15CT348 No Contest
15TR3239 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CM102, 15CT348, and 15TR3239.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Dismiss and read in 16CM158, 15TR3240

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:****
16CM102 Ct 1:  $150 fine + costs = $442.00
5 days jail, can be served all on electronic monitor, 60 days to set up start date.
16CM102 Ct 2: $100 fine + costs = $379.00
15CT348: $100 fine + costs = $379
15TR3239: $10.00 total
60 days to pay fines or set up payment plan
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license. Comply with terms of any outstanding bonds in other cases.

Defendant Paxton Joseph Soik in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:17 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Defendant received a copy of the complaint.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Court finds probable cause exists. 

Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.
Defendant has a current public defender, Ryan Drengler, on other open matters.

Court orders Defendant to make application at the public defender's office within 72 hours from today.

Court enters pleas of NOT GUILTY on behalf of Defendant.

State addresses bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
